textos_fuente.text: ABOUT US - Tin Roof Antiques Tin Roof Antiques Home ABOUT US Along with our retail store, we conduct buyouts of contents of homes and appraisals for probate, insurance and personal purposes.  Because of our knowledge of the market place, we maximize the results for our clients. 1) Appraisals - We offer in-home appraisals or free in-store appraisals. (BOTH BY APPOINTMENT Only) 2) Buyouts - We buy one item or complete estates.  Call us for an estimate. When we are making an offer on the contents. We go through the home and make an offer on the entire contents with the understanding that everything is to be removed except mutually agreed upon items. We are located at the corner of McCausland and Bruno Ave., south of Hwy 64/40, one block north of the intersection of McCausland and Manchester. Web Hosting by Bluehost

Staff & Board of Directors - Diamond Head Theatre Skip to content Box Office: (808) 733-0274 | Business Office: (808) 733-0277 Facebook Instagram YouTube LinkedIn Email Search for: Shows & Tickets Buy Tickets Season Subscriptions Seat Map Show Archive Subscriber Login Donate Annual Giving Capital Campaign Producer’s Club Sponsorship ‘Ilima Awards Auditions Show Auditions Shooting Stars Classes Year-Round Classes Summer Musical Theatre Experience Shooting Stars Instructors Scholarships About Staff & Board of Directors Instructors Volunteer Rentals News Show Archive Your New Theatre Theatrical Arts Building Make a Gift Sponsor a Seat Photos News Capital Campaign Donors Contact BUY TICKETS Staff & Board of Directors Jacque Vaughn 2025-07-23T06:29:51-10:00 STAFF & BOARD OF DIRECTORS We bring the magic of theatre to all Trevor Tamashiro, Executive Director Trevor joined Diamond Head Theatre as Executive Director in April 2023. Born and raised in Hawaii, and a graduate of Punahou School, he brings nearly 20 years of experience in nonprofit executive leadership. Trevor started his journey in New York City working for Broadway Dance Center. Other positions include: Chief Advancement Officer of The Diller-Quaile School of Music; Deputy Director of Saratoga International Theater Institute; and Deputy/Program Director for The Drama League of New York. Trevor is a member of the Association of Fundraising Professionals and is a Certified Fund Raising Executive (CFRE). He holds a degree in Theatre Arts from University of Miami, a Master of Business Administration degree from Pace University, and a Master of Science degree in Nonprofit Management from Columbia University. John Rampage, Artistic Director John Rampage is a performer, actor, choreographer, and director who has served as Diamond Head Theatre’s Artistic Director since 1995. He is the creative mastermind behind all of the theatre’s productions and programs, overseeing the curation of two or more shows each season and selects directors, musical directors, and set designers. His relationship with the theatre began in 1975 where he performed as Tommy Gilas in the 1975 production of Music Man. In the 1980s, Rampage danced and sang his way across the U.S. and Europe and returned in 1991 as choreographer of Evita. More than 120 productions have been shared with the community under his oversight. A 47-time Po‘okela Award winner for excellence in the theatre, John is also the recipient of the Hawaii State Theatre Council 2006 Pierre Bowman Award. We are an independent nonprofit that relies on community support. Diamond Head Theatre recognizes the use of diacritical markings in the modern orthography of Hawaiian language. These markings may be omitted to give you the best experience with our website. 520 Makapuu Avenue Honolulu, Hawaii 96816 Box Office Hours: Monday through Friday 10 am to 4 pm Box Office: (808) 733-0274 Business Office: (808) 733-0277 Click Here to Email Us SIGN UP FOR E-NEWS Subscriber Login FOLLOW US © 2024 Diamond Head Theatre | All Rights Reserved | Privacy Policy | About Accessibility | Site created by Transcendence Pacific. Drink . Takeout Bryants Lane, Maldon, Essex CM9 6TB About Us There is a saying that it takes a village to raise a child. Well, it takes a team of skilled people working to build our café, to realise our vision and bring it all to life, featuring  the following… Walk in Café Just come in, no booking required, we operate as a walk in café, so where you're passing by, visiting the garden centre or just want to relax, drop by, you're always welcome at The Tin Roof Café! Read More In-house Bakery Yes, we have our own bakery where all our delicious cakes are created, producing fresh patisserie and cakes daily. We always use local suppliers where we can, to reduce food miles as well as support local businesses. Read More Alfresco Dining With generous grounds and gardens to explore, you can enjoy alfresco dining, as a walk-in café there's no booking required in case you fancy dropping in. Read More Home grown produce We use the freshest ingredients, including seasonal fruit, vegetables and herbs from our kitchen garden to create delicious food. Read More &copy2025 The Tin Roof Café Website design & development: Made by Nicholson Sitemap Your privacy Follow us

CONTACT US For general inquiries and details, please submit the contact form below. GETTING HERE Tin Roof at The Preserve ​ From North Myrtle Beach take Hwy 9 to 905, then north when the road comes together with 904.  Our drive is on the right, marked by "Low Country Preserve" sign. Turn right onto Indigo Flatts E.  Proceed 1/2 mile.  Take left drive to access venue site. ​ From Wilmington, NC head South on Hwy 17.  Just south of Shallotte, Take 904 the the right at the McDonalds intersection. Proceed on 904 until you T-intersect with 905.  Turn right.  Take the first paved road on your right Indigo Flats E.  Farm is marked by "Low Country Preserve" sign.  Proceed 1/2 mile.  Take first drive to the left, leading to Tin Roof venue. ​ ​ Contact us Our Address Call/text 910-317-5778 Call/text 910-443-1000 Call/rext 910-540-1209 cindy.thetinroof@yahoo.com ​ darby.tinroof@gmail.com tdawkins.lowcountrysports@gmail.com Tin Roof at The Preserve 466 Indigo Flats E Tabor City, NC 28463 bottom of page
